means: 毁坏，损坏，玷污( mar的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: A number of problems marred the smooth running of this event.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多问题影响了这件事的顺利进行。

sentence.Network_en: The game was marred by the behaviour of drunken fans.
sentence.Network_cn: 喝醉了的球迷行为不轨，把比赛给搅了。

sentence.Network_en: Bad diction marred the effectiveness of his speech.
sentence.Network_cn: 措词不当影响了他演说的效果.

PerfectNetExp.abs: the methodology of genetic studies ; an opinion poll marred by faulty methodology ., 遗传学研究的方法 ; 被错误地损害了效果的观点调查.
坏的-的英语翻译-bab.la词典 ... 脾气坏的 grumpy 被毁坏的 marred 累坏的 done in.
Their marriage was marred by perpetual contest ., 他们的婚姻毁于无休止的争论.

entry.def: To mar something means to spoil or damage it.

example.ex: A number of problems marred the smooth running of this event...
example.tran: 许多问题影响了这件事的顺利进行。

example.ex: That election was marred by massive cheating.
example.tran: 大范围的舞弊破坏了那次选举。

means.word_mean: 1. having the surface damaged or disfigured
2. blemished by injury or rough wear;

auth_sentence.content: His interesting ideas are rather marred by a self-indulgent...style.
auth_sentence.res_content: His interesting ideas are rather marred by a self-indulgent...style.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His interesting ideas are rather marred by a self-indulgent...style.

auth_sentence.content: Not a wrinkle marred the smoothness of her skin.
auth_sentence.res_content: Not a wrinkle marred the smoothness of her skin.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Not a wrinkle marred the smoothness of her skin.

auth_sentence.content: Western observers say the poll was marred by fraud.
auth_sentence.res_content: Western observers say the poll was marred by fraud.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Western observers say the poll was marred by fraud.
